name: commit-message-formatter
description: Break long lines in commit messages.

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Truncate the subject at the limit, moving the rest to the message body. Example:

`Lorem Ip`

`sum`

Truncate the subject at the limit, moving the rest to the message body. Add a three-dots suffix to the subject, and a three-dots prefix to the body. Example:

`Lorem Ip...`

`...sum`

Split the subject at the last space character before the limit, moving the rest to the message body. Example:

`Lorem`

`Ipsum`

Split the subject at the last space character before the limit, moving the rest to the message body. Add a three-dots suffix to the subject, and a three-dots prefix to the body. Example:

`Lorem...`

`...Ipsum`
commit-message-formatter.subjectMode.markdownDescription: How to handle the subject line if it is longer than the allowed length. Subject length can be set in `#git.inputValidationSubjectLength#`.

commit-message-formatter.collapseMultipl.description: Collapse multiple blank lines to single one.

commit-message-formatter.protectedPatter.description: Keep the line untouched, which begins with one of these patterns.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
